quote.text: And it came to pass in those days, that there went out a decree from Caesar Augustus that all the world should be taxed.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: (And this taxing was first made when Cyrenius was governor of Syria.)
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And all went to be taxed, every one into his own city.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And Joseph also went up from Galilee, out of the city of Nazareth, into Judaea, unto the city of David, which is called Bethlehem; (because he was of the house and lineage of David:)
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: To be taxed with Mary his espoused wife, being great with child.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And so it was, that, while they were there, the days were accomplished that she should be delivered.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And she brought forth her firstborn son, and wrapped him in swaddling clothes, and laid him in a manger; because there was no room for them in the inn.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And there were in the same country shepherds abiding in the field, keeping watch over their flock by night.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And, lo, the angel of the Lord came upon them, and the glory of the Lord shone round about them: and they were sore afraid.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And the angel said unto them, Fear not: for, behold, I bring you good tidings of great joy, which shall be to all people.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: For unto you is born this day in the city of David a Saviour, which is Christ the Lord.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And this shall be a sign unto you; Ye shall find the babe wrapped in swaddling clothes, lying in a manger.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly host praising God, and saying,
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Glory to God in the highest, and on earth peace, good will toward men.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And it came to pass, as the angels were gone away from them into heaven, the shepherds said one to another, Let us now go even unto Bethlehem, and see this thing which is come to pass, which the Lord hath made known unto us.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And they came with haste, and found Mary, and Joseph, and the babe lying in a manger.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And when they had seen it, they made known abroad the saying which was told them concerning this child.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And all they that heard it wondered at those things which were told them by the shepherds.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: But Mary kept all these things, and pondered them in her heart.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things that they had heard and seen, as it was told unto them.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And when eight days were accomplished for the circumcising of the child, his name was called JESUS, which was so named of the angel before he was conceived in the womb.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And when the days of her purification according to the law of Moses were accomplished, they brought him to Jerusalem, to present him to the Lord;
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: (As it is written in the law of the LORD, Every male that openeth the womb shall be called holy to the Lord;)
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And to offer a sacrifice according to that which is said in the law of the Lord, A pair of turtledoves, or two young pigeons.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And, behold, there was a man in Jerusalem, whose name was Simeon; and the same man was just and devout, waiting for the consolation of Israel: and the Holy Ghost was upon him.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And it was revealed unto him by the Holy Ghost, that he should not see death, before he had seen the Lord's Christ.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And he came by the Spirit into the temple: and when the parents brought in the child Jesus, to do for him after the custom of the law,
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Then took he him up in his arms, and blessed God, and said,
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Lord, now lettest thou thy servant depart in peace, according to thy word:
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: For mine eyes have seen thy salvation,
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Which thou hast prepared before the face of all people;
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: A light to lighten the Gentiles, and the glory of thy people Israel.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And Joseph and his mother marvelled at those things which were spoken of him.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And Simeon blessed them, and said unto Mary his mother, Behold, this child is set for the fall and rising again of many in Israel; and for a sign which shall be spoken against;
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: (Yea, a sword shall pierce through thy own soul also,) that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And there was one Anna, a prophetess, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Aser: she was of a great age, and had lived with an husband seven years from her virginity;
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And she was a widow of about fourscore and four years, which departed not from the temple, but served God with fastings and prayers night and day.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And she coming in that instant gave thanks likewise unto the Lord, and spake of him to all them that looked for redemption in Jerusalem.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And when they had performed all things according to the law of the Lord, they returned into Galilee, to their own city Nazareth.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And the child grew, and waxed strong in spirit, filled with wisdom: and the grace of God was upon him.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: Now his parents went to Jerusalem every year at the feast of the passover.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And when he was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem after the custom of the feast.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And when they had fulfilled the days, as they returned, the child Jesus tarried behind in Jerusalem; and Joseph and his mother knew not of it.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: But they, supposing him to have been in the company, went a day's journey; and they sought him among their kinsfolk and acquaintance.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And when they found him not, they turned back again to Jerusalem, seeking him.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And it came to pass, that after three days they found him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the doctors, both hearing them, and asking them questions.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And all that heard him were astonished at his understanding and answers.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And when they saw him, they were amazed: and his mother said unto him, Son, why hast thou thus dealt with us? behold, thy father and I have sought thee sorrowing.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And he said unto them, How is it that ye sought me? wist ye not that I must be about my Father's business?
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And they understood not the saying which he spake unto them.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And he went down with them, and came to Nazareth, and was subject unto them: but his mother kept all these sayings in her heart.
quote.author: Luke

quote.text: And Jesus increased in wisdom and stature, and in favour with God and man.
quote.author: Luke
